page.title: 01SUMMARY OF AREA
page.content: THE AREA SURVEYED LIES TO THE NORTH EAST OF GLOUCESTER CITY. IT INCLUDES PART OF THE CITY AND THE VILLAGES OF INNSWORTH AND CHURCHDOWN. THE VILLAGES OF INNSWORTH AND CHUCHDOWN ARE SEPARATED FROM THE CITY BY THE NEW BY-PASS BUILT IN 1984. MOST OF THE LAND LIES IN THE VALLEY OF THE RIVER SEVERN. TO THE EAST OF THE AREA THE LAND RISES TOWARDS CHOSEN HILL (ALT. 154 M.), AN OUTLIER OF THE COTSWOLD ESCARPMENT. TO THE NORTH EAST OF THE AREA IS AN OPEN TRACT OF LAND CLOSE TO THE RIVER SEVERN ALONGSIDE THE A38 GLOUCESTER TO TEWKESBURY ROAD. THE AREA INCLUDES R.A.F. INNSWORTH, AN ADMINISTRATIVE CENTRE OF THE R.A.F.
